intro: Gongora armeniaca subsp. cornuta, commonly known as the horned gongora, is a striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is characterized by its elongated, spurred lip that resembles a horn, giving it its common name. The plant produces pendulous inflorescences with bright orange or yellow flowers that are highly ornamental. Its leaves are dark green,革质 (leathery), and often have a waxy coating. This subspecies is appreciated by orchid enthusiasts for its unique morphology and vibrant coloration.
